comment._content: is his gun identifiable as well?

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From dmna.ny.gov/historic/reghist/civil/rosters/cavalry/3rdCav... "WARNEAR, ELIAS.—Age, 22 years. Enlisted October 17,1861, at Darnestown, Md.; mustered in as private, Company E, October 17, 1861, to serve three years; re-enlisted, December 16, 1863; transferred July 12, 1865, to Company B ; transferred, July 21, 1865, to Company B, First N. Y. Mounted Rifles; also borne as Elias Warner." A 1927 (or 1929) obituary files.usgwarchives.net/md/washington/obits/warner-e.txt could be the same guy. Washington County MD Archives Obituaries.....Elias WARNER, January 29, 1929 The Frederick Post, Monday, January 31, 1927 Elias Warner, aged 87 years, a retired farmer of near Pleasant Hill, died on Saturday night at Montevue Hospital where he had been a boarding patient for some months. For six years he had been at the Fahrney Memorial Home, Washington county. He was a veteran of the Civil war, a member of Third New York Cavalry. He is survived by a daughter, Mrs. George S. Martz, Pleasant Hill, three grandchildren and six great-grandchildren.
